title: Firefox will not start (maybe NFS related) "Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccesible."
content:
I am trying to run Firefox 94.0 on Ubuntu Linux 20.04. My home directory is NFS mounted. When I start Firefox, a window pops up that says "Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible."

Here is what I have tried so far. First, I have moved away ~/.mozilla. Then I tried moving away ~/.thunderbird. I see that Firefox does create a new ~/.mozilla directory with these contents:

firefox 

   Crash Reports/        events/        InstallTime2021102816135    Pending Pings/

systemextensionsdev/

I have tried running Firefox like so:

firefox -P firefox --ProfileManager firefox --first-start firefox --safe-mode

All result in the same popup window.

I tried moving the .mozilla directory to somewhere locally on the computer, and made a symlink in my home directory to it.

I tried firefox --profile with the path to a profile stored locally on the computer.

I tried:

HOME=/somewherelocal firefox

And that caused some other problems.

I tried strace -f firefox but that produces so much output I don't know where to begin to figure out why it is behaving this way.

I've uninstalled Firefox, and reinstalled it (apt-get remove; apt-get install). I've rebooted the computer. I've updated Ubuntu to all the latest packages.

I think I've run out of things to try. Please help.

Thanks.

title: Problema de acceso a google - youtube - gmail...
content:
Hola gente de Mozilla

Tengo un problema con Mozilla Firefox en Windows 10, siempre ha sido mi navegador favorito, pero desde hace unos dias no puedo acceder a nada que tenga q ver con google, ni el buscador, ni youtube, ni gmail

Me sale el siguiente mensaje

''No se ha conectado: Posible problema de seguridad

Firefox ha detectado una potencial amenaza de seguridad y no ha continuado a www.google.com porque este sitio web requiere una conexión segura.

¿Qué puede hacer al respecto?

www.google.com tiene una política de seguridad llamada HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), que significa que Firefox solo puede conectarse a él de forma segura. No puede añadir una excepción para visitar este sitio.

El problema está probablemente en el sitio web, y no hay nada que pueda hacer para resolverlo.

Si está en una red corporativa o utilizando un antivirus, puede ponerse en contacto con el equipo de asistencia para obtener ayuda. También puede notificar el problema al administrador del sitio web.''

Alguna solución, he probado a reiniciar Firefox y a desinstalar e instalar y sigue igual. El navegador funciona en todo el resto de webs

Gracias por la ayuda
creator: cachirulo66

title: Shift + ENTER on text boxes is not working consistently
content:
Trying to send multi line messages in WhatsApp for Web is not working as expected. From my tests, most of the times after pressing Shift + ENTER the cursor will not move to the next line (strangely, sometimes it works). And this will make the user to press again Shift + ENTER. Now the cursor finally is on the second line, as it should have been after the first try. But when starting to write, an empty line appears, which means the first new line command actually worked, it was there but was invisible and showing up only after starting to type "normal" characters.

Steps to reproduce: 1. write something, for example "line 1" 2. press Shift ENTER (cursor is still on the first line) 3. press again Shift ENTER (cursor finally moves to the second line) 4. write again, for example "line 2" (this new text will jump to another line)

So instead of: > line 1 > line 2

We will have: > line 1 > > line 2

PS: Tested in Chrome and Edge and in both is working perfectly. The problem can be reproduced only in Firefox (version 94.0.1 64bit).

title: Firefox keeps force-restarting itself.
content:
Firefox keeps restarting itself. It's not crashing, just closint tiself and reopening. If I have multiple tabs open, I get the tabs warning, but even if i click not to close, it closes and restarts anyway. This often happens umprompted even if the app has been in the backround untouched for a few minutes (or hours) such as when ive left it on my 2nd screen to refer to when playing a game or working. Having multiple windows open means it restarts all of them. Sometimes, opening a new tab or window, or upon starting firefox from closed will trigger the same behaviour, but this isn't consistant.

This has been going on about 6-8 months, across multiple updates. Until now it's been an annoyance, but i recently got a new job working from home, and it's starting to impact my ability to work, since some of that work is in-bowser. I've lost 15-30 minutes here and there a few times, and I lost 4 hours work the other day becuase the brower restarted without allowing me a chance to save my work. If I can't find a solution to this, i might be forced to change my browser, which i would really prefer not to do.

I only have a few addons, and disabling them hasn't seemed to solve the issue : ReloadMatic (Lets you set tabs to reload automatically on a timer), Tampermonkey, uBlock Origin, and Yahoo Search

Any help or advice would be greatly appreciated. Thank you. Kreldin

title: External-apps' links' opening -- SOME in existing FF tab, SOME in new FF window.  Why & how to fix?
content:
I run Firefox 94.0/Linux

In `user.js` I've set

user_pref("browser.link.open_newwindow", 3); user_pref("browser.link.open_newwindow.restriction", 0); user_pref("browser.link.open_newwindow.override.external", -1);

IIUC, with that config, links opened from other apps should open in new tabs in an existing/running instance of FF.

In a Tbird email, I've two links.

If I click on the 1st,

https://www.amazon.com/gp/your-account/ship-track?ie=UTF8&orderId=xxx-xxxxxxx-xxxxxx&packageIndex=0&shipmentId=xxxxxxxxx&ref_=scr_pt_tp_t

it behaves in exactly that way ... opened in a new tab in existing FF instance.

But if I click on the 2nd,

http://wwwapps.ups.com/WebTracking/processInputRequest?HTMLVersion=5.0&loc=en_US&Requester=UPSHome&tracknum=1ZYxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx &AgreeToTermsAndConditions=yes&track.x=28&track.y=10

a new FF instance is launched, and the link is opened in a new, sized window in that new instance.

Why do the two links behave differently with this config?

What do I need to change so that ALL links behave like the 1st one -- opened in new tab in the existing/running instance of FF?

creator: Kotaina

title: Migrating session from SeaMonkey to Firefox
content:
I've been using SeaMonkey for quite a while now, but I am slowly coming to terms with it being a memory hog, that has some apparent memory leak in it. Despite having 64 GiB of RAM in my desktop, running it for a few days - though with many tabs - can still cause it to crash, sometimes the entire OS.

So I want to migrate the session from SeaMonkey to Firefox, i.e. preserve my tabs. Copying keys3.db and logins.sqlite ensures my passwords are copied over. But copying places.sqlite or sessionstore.json from my SeaMonkey profile to Firefox does not work.

Inspect places.sqlite both generated by Firefox and SeaMonkey, I notice that they do not have the same schema for moz_places, so I wonder if that is upsetting Firefox, and scraps the entire file. I notice that Firefox - while not using sessionstore.json any more - is using another file called sessionstore.jsonlz4, I wonder if I could convert my SeaMonkey sessionstore.json to a sessionstore.jsonlz4 file, that Firefox might be able to load it. However, finding guides on how to generate a jsonlz4 is hard, since most - if not all - are about decoding them.

So I am a bit stumped. How do I migrate my SeaMonkey session to Firefox? I can live with losing my history, and I don't use bookmarks. We are talking about well over 100 tabs, and I'd hate having to enter them manually.

I am using Firefox 92 and SeaMonkey 2.53.8.1 on Fedora 33.
creator: svip7782

title: Firefox freezes whenever using the System File Browser (Finder)
